The video reporting the arrest of Mirand: suggesting a significant amount of attention and discussion around the claim.
The source of the claim: the NotThis News Twitter account, was identified as a parody account, mimicking the legitimate NowThis News company. This raises doubts about the credibility and authenticity of the information presented in the video.
The video used the real NowThis News log: potentially misleading viewers into believing it originated from the genuine news source. This manipulation of branding adds to the suspicion surrounding the claim.
Additional graphics from TMZ and Al Jaze: aiming to enhance its credibility. However, the use of unrelated audio subtitles and the lack of matching content cast doubt on the accuracy of the report.
